ArdhaChandrasana.description: Half Moon Pose. A standing balance posture that strengthens the legs, ankles, and core while improving coordination and concentration.
ArdhaChandrasana.benefits: Improves balance and coordination, strengthens legs and ankles, stretches the chest, shoulders, and spine.

BaddhaKonasana.description: Bound Angle Pose. A seated forward bend that stretches the inner thighs, groin, and knees while providing a gentle twist to the spine.
BaddhaKonasana.benefits: Stimulates abdominal organs, ovaries and prostate gland, bladder, and kidneys. Stretches the inner thighs, groins, and knees.

Downward-Facing Dog.description: An inversion that builds strength in the arms, shoulders, and core while stretching the hamstrings and calves.
Downward-Facing Dog.benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression, energizes the body, stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands.

Natarajasana.description: Dancer Pose. A graceful and challenging standing posture that requires balance, flexibility, and concentration.
Natarajasana.benefits: Stretches the shoulders, chest, thighs, groin, and abdomen. Strengthens the legs and ankles, improves balance.

Triangle.description: Triangle Pose. A standing pose that stretches the legs, hips, and spine while improving balance and focus.
Triangle.benefits: Stretches and strengthens the thighs, knees, and ankles, relieves backache, especially through second trimester of pregnancy.

UtkataKonasana.description: Goddess Pose. A powerful standing pose that strengthens the legs, ankles, and core while improving balance and stability.
UtkataKonasana.benefits: Strengthens the legs, glutes, hips, and core muscles, improves balance, opens the hips.

Veerabhadrasana.description: Warrior Pose. A series of standing postures that build strength, stamina, and focus while promoting a sense of empowerment and determination.
Veerabhadrasana.benefits: Strengthens and stretches the legs and ankles, increases stamina, relieves backaches.

Vrukshasana.description: Tree Pose. A standing balance posture that strengthens the legs, ankles, and core while improving focus and concentration.
Vrukshasana.benefits: Strengthens thighs, calves, ankles, and spine, stretches the groins and inner thighs, chest, and shoulders.
